title: 111_hr4311
content: The Act titled "Bonus Depreciation and Enhanced Expensing for Small Businesses Extension Act of 2009" extends increased expensing for small businesses until 2010. It also provides a special allowance for certain property acquired during 2010. The Act extends the special allowance for certain property acquired until January 1, 2012, and makes conforming amendments to the Internal Revenue Code. The Code is amended to change dates from January 1, 2009 to January 1, 2010 in various sections. Additionally, the election to accelerate the AMT and research credits in lieu of bonus depreciation is extended from January 1, 2010 to January 1, 2011. The Code is amended to change dates from January 1, 2009 to January 1, 2010 in various sections. The election to accelerate the AMT and research credits in lieu of bonus depreciation is extended from January 1, 2010 to January 1, 2011. Special rules for 2010 extension property are outlined for taxpayers who previously elected acceleration. The maximum amount and increase amount are computed and applied to eligible qualified property, including 2010 extension property. Taxpayers who did not previously elect acceleration can make the election for their first taxable year ending after December 31. The paragraph discusses the application of maximum increase amount to eligible qualified property, specifically 2010 extension property. Taxpayers can elect acceleration for their first taxable year ending after December 31, 2009. The term '2010 extension property' refers to property eligible solely due to the extension of special allowance under the Bonus Depreciation and Enhanced Expensing for Small Businesses Extension Act of 2009. The amendments apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2009, in taxable years ending after that date.
